<|endoftext|>/*
Return vector of all prefixes from shortest to longest of the input string
>>> allPrefixes("abc")
{"a", "ab", "abc"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> allPrefixes(string str){
    vector<string> prefixes;
    string prefix = "";
    for(int i=0;i<str.size();i++){
        prefix = prefix + str[i];
        if(str[i] == str[str.size()-1]){
            prefixes.push_back(prefix);
        }
    }
    return prefixes;
}
/*
Return vector of all suffixes from shortest to longest of the input string
>>> allSuffixes("abc")
{"bc", "c"}
*/
vector<string> allSuffixes(string str){
    vector<string> suffixes;
    string suffix = "";
    for(int i=0;i<str.size();i++){
        suffix = str[str.size()-i-1] + suffix;
        if(str[i] == str[0]){
            suffixes.push_back(suffix);
        }
    }
    return suffixes;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Given a string 'text", return its md5 hash equivalent string.
If 'text" is an empty string, return None.

>>> stringToMd5("Hello world") == "3e25960a79dbc69b674cd4ec67a72c62"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
#include<openssl/md5.h>
using namespace std;
string stringToMd5(string text){
    MD5_CTX md5;
    MD5_Init(&md5);
    MD5_Update(&md5, text.c_str(), text.length());
    unsigned char digest[16];
    MD5_Final(digest, &md5);
    string md5 = base64_encode(digest);
    return md5;
}
/*
Given a string 'text', return its sha1 hash equivalent string.
If 'text' is an empty string, return None.

>>> stringToSha1("Hello world") == "9f86d081884c7d659a2feaa0c55ad015a3bf4f1b2b0b822cd15d6c15b0f00a08"
*/
string stringToSha1(string text){
    SHA_CTX sha;
    SHA1_Init(&sha);
    SHA1_Update(&sha, text.c_str(), text.length());
    unsigned char digest[20];
    SHA1_Final(digest, &sha);
    string sha1 = base64_encode(digest);
    return sha1;
}
/*
Given a string 'text', return its sha256 hash equivalent string.

*/
string stringToSha256(string text){
    SHA256_CTX sha;
    SHA256_Init(&sha);
    SHA256_Update(&sha, text.c_str(), text.length());
    unsigned char digest[32];
    SHA256_Final(digest, &sha);
    string sha256 = base64_encode(digest);
    return sha256;
}
/*
Given a string 'text', return its sha512 hash equivalent string.

*/
string stringToSha512(string text){
    SHA512_CTX sha;
    SHA512_Init(&sha);
    SHA512_Update(&sha, text.c_str(), text.length());
    unsigned char digest[64];
    SHA512_Final(digest, &sha);
    string sha512 = base64_encode(digest);
    return sha512;
}

<|endoftext|>#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evaluates polynomial with coefficients xs at point x. return xs[0] + xs[1] * x + xs[1] * x^2 +.... xs[n] * x^n 
    */
    double sum=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
    }
    return sum;
}

double find_zero(vector<double> xs){
    /*
    xs are coefficients of a polynomial. find_zero find x such that poly(x) = 0. find_zero returns only only zero point, even if there are many. 
    Moreover, find_zero only takes list xs having even number of coefficients and largest non zero coefficient as it guarantees a solution.
    >>> round(find_zero([1, 2]), 2) #f(x) = 1 + 2x 
    -0.5 
    >>> round(find_zero([-6, 11, -6, 1]), 2) # (x - 1) * (x - 2) * (x - 3) = -6 + 11x - 6x^2 + x^3 
    1.0
    */
    double zero=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        if (xs[i]==0)
        {
            zero=xs[i];
            break;
        }
    }
    return zero;
}

double find_root(vector<double> xs){
    /*
    xs are coefficients of a polynomial. find_root find x such that poly(x) = 0. find_root returns only root point, even if there are many. 
    Moreover, find_root only takes list xs having even number of coefficients and largest non zero coefficient as it guarantees a solution.
    >>> round(find_root([1, 2]), 2) #f(x) = 1 + 2x 
    1.0 
    >>> round(find_root([-6, 11, -6, 1]), 2) # (x - 1) * (x - 2) * (x - 3) = -6 + 11x - 6x^2 + x^3 
    1.0
    */
    double root=xs[0];
    int i;
    for (i=1;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        if (xs[i]==0)
        {
            root=xs[i];
            break;
        }
    }
    return root;
}

double find_derivative(vector<double> xs){
    /*
    xs are coefficients of a polynomial. find_derivative find x such that poly(x) = 0. find_derivative returns only derivative point, even if there are many. 
    Moreover, find_derivative only takes list xs having even number of coefficients and largest non zero coefficient as it guarantees a solution.
    >>> round(find_derivative([1, 2]), 2) #f(x) = 1 + 2x 
    2.0 
    >>> round(find_derivative([-6, 11, -6, 1]), 2) # (x - 1) * (x - 2) * (x - 3) = -6 + 11x - 6x^2 + x^3 
    0.0
    */
    double derivative=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        if (xs[i]==0)
        {
            derivative=xs[i];
            break;
        }
    }
    return derivative;
}
